history.content:
The only reason you want to declare a major should be you love it or you need something significant from it. 

------

The only major that can get you priority for CS classes is to be a EECS/CS Major.  Being a Data Science major will get you priority for CS C100 only as far as I can tell, though it sounds like there may be other DS-specific classes in the works.  Being undeclared gets you priority for the lower div CS and EE classes.
The only reason you want to declare a major should be you love it or you need something significant from it.

Right now I have taken 61A (Got a B), 61B (Got a B), and Math 55 (Got an A), so I can declare the double major. However, I am realizing that doing this would be a lot of unnecessary work because I have to take 5 upper div math classes. I was wondering if actually being declared rather than doing another major such as data science would make a big difference in getting the CS classes you want. Another option I have is to take CS 70, but I would have to get an A. I took it summer 2018 but had to drop because I did poorly on the second midterm. I'm kind of stuck on these three options and don't really know where to go from here since I am a sophomore.
history.subject: Is a CS + Applied Math Double Major worth it?
